info.name: Validated Relationship Service - Integration - 20/02/26
info.description:
## About the collection

The collection has been organised by API endpoint - you will find a folder for each one.

Within those endpoints are requests covering success and error response scenarios.

Each request has at least 1 example against it. This shows the expected response for that request. Some requests have multiple examples showing how the response differs when different parameters are provided.

### Authorization types

When you send a request to the Validated Relationship Service, your request will first be authorised by the API Management service (APIM).

The Validated Relationship Service has 3 types of authorization:

- CIS2 - For healthcare practitioners
- App-restricted - for service-to-service authorization
- Login - For patient/proxy access via the NHS App
    

Each VRS API endpoint uses a different combination of these auth types depending on their use case.

You will need to follow the steps in the 'Getting Started' section below to set the correct authorization tokens for each of these types.

Please see the folder-level docs for each endpoint for details about what auth types are available to use.

## Getting started

### Environment variables

You will need to add the following environment variables to the collection.

#### `cis2_token`

Authorization token value for CIS2 (healthcare practitioner access).

_Only required when using endponts that require this auth method._

This value can be generated by running the `get_cis2_access_token_int.py` script . See more details in the 'How to create a valid Authorization header' section below.

#### `login_token`

Authorization token value for NHS Login (patient access).

_Only required when using endponts that require this auth method._

This value can be generated by running the `get_nhs_login_access_token_int.py` script . See more details in the 'How to create a valid Authorization header' section below.

#### `vrs_api_private_key`

**(This is not the same as the private key in the NHS Developer Account portal.)**

API private key for the Validated Relationship Service integration application.

_Only required when using endponts that use the app restricted auth method._

This value can be copied from the /main/vrs-app-credentials-{id} secret in **AWS Secrets Manager** or requested to be sent securely from a member of the VRS team.

#### `nhs_developer_account_api_key`

API app key for the Validated Relationship Service integration application.

_Only required when using endponts that use the app restricted auth method._

This value can be copied from the NHS - Proxy Core Services - Integration environment resource in the NHS Developer Account portal.

#### `consent_app_auth_header_value` (Generated automatically)

Authorization token value for app restricted auth.

_Only required when using endponts that use the app restricted auth method._

**You do not need to change this value as it is automatically set in the pre-request script.**

#### `tpp_9674998535_access_token`, `tpp_9674998454_access_token`, `emis_9692113698_access_token,` and `emis_9692113612_access_token`

Authorization token value for connecting to GPIT supplier systems in NAM tests (Get proxy roles only).

_Only required when running the_ `_Get proxy roles (GET/Consent) Valid request - NAM - Get proxy roles_` _requests._

Values for these environment variables can be found on the [Test data page in Confluence](https://nhsd-confluence.digital.nhs.uk/spaces/NPA/pages/950553445/Test+data+and+accounts+repository+-+NPA#TestdataandaccountsrepositoryNPA-GPITtestaccountsforEXT).

### How to create a valid Authorization header

#### Manually through Python scripts (required for Login and CIS2)

##### Pre-requisites

Access the token generation scripts from the [validated-relationships-service-api repo](https://github.com/NHSDigital/validated-relationships-service-api/tree/master/scripts):

- get_app_access_token_int.py - for app restricted authorization
- get_cis2_access_token_int.py - for CIS2 authorization
- get_nhs_login_access_token_int.py - for Login user authorization
    

See the [README](https://github.com/NHSDigital/validated-relationships-service-api/tree/master/scripts/README.md) for information about how to run them and what environment variables are needed.

##### Steps

1. Generate bearer tokens for each of the above methods using the provided scripts
2. Go to the Authorization tab for this Postman request
3. Select 'Bearer token' from the drop-down
4. Copy just the 'access_request' value from the script output into the Token field. You do **not** need to add the word 'bearer' before the value.
    

Tokens expire every 5 minutes. Once expired, you will receive an 'Unauthorised' response from the API endpoints. At this point, a new token will need to be generated by repeating the above steps.

#### Automatically through pre-request script (for App-restricted)

A pre-request script has been added to the endpoints where app-restricted auth can be used to obtain app-restricted tokens automatically. For this to work, you will need to add values for the following environment variables:

- `private_key`
- `api_key`
    

If those values are set and valid, then no further action is required.

## Running a request

Once you have completed the above 'Getting Started' steps you will be able to send requests by either clicking the 'Send' button on each request, or the 'Try' button on each example.

The pre-prod environments are not constricted to just the requests provided in this collection. Feel free to change and create requests/examples as you require. However, only the test users provided will work in these environments.

## Test data

All of the requests in the collection use test data and users that have been set up to demonstrate each specific scenario. No sensitive data is stored in this collection.

See each scenario for information about what test users are being used.

item.name: Get proxy roles (GET /Consent)
Valid request - NPS - Get proxy roles for performer

header.description: For pre-prod only - Used to control where data is gathered from to fulfill the request

request.description:
This request and its examples will only retrieve proxy roles from the National Proxy Store and not directly from GPIT suppliers via NAM.

See folder-level docs for more info.

## Example scenario

**Given** proxy roles exist for a performer (proxy) in the National Proxy Store (NPS)  
**When** a GET /Consent request is sent with the performer identifier  
**Then** the proxy roles in NPS are returned

## Authorization

Please see the folder overview for details of how to generate tokens for this endpoint.

item.name: Valid request - NAM - Get proxy roles

header.description: For pre-prod only - Used to control where data is gathered from to fulfill the request

request.description:
This request and its examples will only retrieve proxy roles directly from GPIT suppliers via NAM and not from the National Proxy Store.

See folder level docs for more info.

## Example scenario

**Given** proxy roles exist for a patient/performer in a GPIT system  
**And** no proxy roles exist in the National Proxy Store (NPS) for the patient/performer  
**When** a GET /Consent request is sent with the performer/patient identifier  
**Then** the proxy roles from GPIT are returned

## Authorization

Please see the folder overview for details of how to generate tokens for this endpoint.

item.name: GP practice not found - Get proxy roles

header.description: For pre-prod only - Used to control where data is gathered from to fulfill the request

request.description:
## Example scenario

**Given** a performer/patient is not registered at a GP  
**And** the performer/patient has no proxy roles in the National Proxy Store  
**When** a GET /Consent request is sent for the performer/patient  
**Then** a 404 error is returned with the detail 'GP Practice could not be found - invalid resources cannot be retrieved'

## Authorization

Please see the folder overview for details of how to generate tokens for this endpoint.

response.name: GP practice not found error returned

header.description: For pre-prod only - Used to control where data is gathered from to fulfill the request

item.description:
## Authorization

### Allowed auth methods

- App restricted token
    
- NHS Login token - Auth with test user `9730675929`
    
- CIS2 token - Auth with test user `656005750108`
    

See collection level documentation for info about how to get authorization tokens.

## NPS and NAM routing

You will notice that there are 'Valid request - NPS' and 'Valid request - NAM' requests and examples within this folder. These are set up to retrieve the proxy roles from different data sources:

- **Valid request - NPS**: Retrieves the roles from the National Proxy Store (NPS) only. Following the eventual migration of all proxy and related person data from GPIT to NPS, this will become the only route for all requests.
    
- **Valid request - NAM:** Retrives the roles as related person data from the GPIT suppliers via NAM without checking if any exist in NPS first. This requires specific connection parameters to authorise with the GPIT supplier systems
    

This routing is controlled in the requests by the `X-Test-Routing-Flag` header. This header is used in the VRS pre-prod environments to control where the proxy roles are retrieved from. It is intended to be used for testing purposes only. Omission of this header will cause the default routing settings for the given environment to be followed instead. This is typically for roles to be retrieved from NPS, with NAM used as a fallback if none are found.

exec: throw new Error("Variable vrs_api_private_key must be set with your private key for signed JWT authentication.");
// Replace any '/n' new lines with actual new lines
throw new Error("Variable nhs_developer_account_app_key must be set with your integration testing application API key.");
'exp': currentTimestamp + 180, // expiry time is 180 seconds from time of creation
var sJWT = KJUR.jws.JWS.sign(header.alg, JSON.stringify(header), JSON.stringify(data), privateKey);

item.name: Get proxy role (GET /Consent/{id})
Valid request - Get proxy role

request.description:
## Example scenario

**Given** a proxy role exists between a performer and a patient in the National Proxy Store  
**When** a GET /Consent/{id} request is sent with the consent id of the proxy role  
**Then** the proxy role is returned

response.name: Proxy role returned - No patient or grantee details
Proxy role returned - Include grantee details
Proxy role returned - Include patient details
Proxy role returned - Include performer and patient details

item.name: Invalid consent id - Get proxy role

request.description:
## Example scenario

**Given** a proxy role exists between a performer and a patient in the National Proxy Store  
**When** a GET /Consent/{id} request is sent where the ID is invalid  
**Then** a 400 error is returned with details including 'Required parameter(s) are invalid.'

response.name: Invalid consent id error returned

request.description:

**Given** a proxy role does not exist between a performer and a patient in the National Proxy Store

item.name: Create a new proxy role (POST /Consent)
Valid request - New proxy role

request.description:
## Important - duplicates

We cannot currently accept duplicate proxy role requests for testing purposes.

This may lead to you experiencing 409 errors on the 'valid request' scenarios if the same request has already been sent.

## Example scenario

**Given** no proxy role exists in NPS between a proxy and patient  
**When** I send a POST /Consent request for the proxy and patient  
**Then** a 201 success response is returned

response.name: Adult to child - New proxy role created
Adult to adult - New proxy role created

item.name: Duplicate role - New proxy role

request.description:
## Example scenario

**Given** a proxy role already exists in NPS between a proxy and patient  
**When** I send a POST /Consent request for the same proxy and patient  
**Then** a 409 error is returned with code 'DUPLICATE_RELATIONSHIP'

response.name: Duplicate role error returned

item.name: Invalid path - Update proxy role

request.description:
## Example scenario

**Given** a proxy role exists in the National Proxy Store for a given UUID  
**When** a PATCH /Consent request with an invalid path is sent using the UUID  
**Then** a 400 error is returned with code 'INVALID_PATCH_PATH'

response.name: Invalid path error returned

item.name: Missing free text for Other

request.description:
## Example scenario

**Given** a proxy role exists in the National Proxy Store for a given UUID  
**When** a PATCH /Consent request with a missing free text and status reason of 'Other' is sent using the UUID  
**Then** a 400 error is returned with code 'MISSING_FREE_TEXT_FOR_OTHER'

response.name: Missing free text error

item.description:
## Allowed auth methods

- CIS2 token - Auth with test user `656005750108`
    
- NHS Login token - Auth with test user `9730675929`
    

See collection level documentation for info about how to get authorization tokens.

item.name: Get verified candidate relationships (GET /RelatedPerson)
Valid request - Get verified candidate relationships

query.description: NHS number of the user to retrieve verified relationships for

request.description:
## Example scenario

**Given** an NHS user has multiple related person relationships in PDS  
**When** a GET /RelatedPerson request is sent for the user  
**Then** the relationships are returned

response.name: Candidate relationship returned

query.description: NHS number of the user to retrieve verified relationships for

response.name: Candidate relationship returned with patient details

query.description: NHS number of the user to retrieve verified relationships for

item.name: Valid request - No relationships returned - Get verified candidate relationships

query.description: NHS number of the user to retrieve verified relationships for

request.description:
## Example scenario

**Given** an NHS user has no related person relationships in PDS  
**When** a GET /RelatedPerson request is sent for the user  
**Then** no relationships are returned

response.name: No relationships returned

query.description: NHS number of the user to retrieve verified relationships for

item.name: Valid request - Verify relationship - Get verified candidate relationships

query.description: NHS number of the user to retrieve verified relationships for

request.description:
## Example scenario

**Given** a proxy has a related person relationship in PDS  
**When** a GET /RelatedPerson request is sent for the proxy and the patient  
**Then** the relationship is returned

response.name: Verified relationship returned

query.description: NHS number of the user to retrieve verified relationships for

response.name: Verified relationship returned with patient details

query.description: NHS number of the user to retrieve verified relationships for

item.name: Missing identifier value - Get verified candidate relationships

request.description:
## Example scenario

**Given** a proxy has a related person relationship in PDS  
**When** a GET /RelatedPerson request is sent with no identifier  
**Then** a 400 error is returned with code 'MISSING_IDENTIFIER_VALUE'

response.name: Missing identifier value error returned

item.name: Invalid identifier value - Get verified candidate relationships

request.description:

**Given** a proxy has a related person relationship in PDS  
**When** a GET /RelatedPerson request is sent with an invalid identifier

response.name: Invalid identifier value error returned
